title: @Riot @Meddler Pls DON'T rework Azir
body:
Pls don't rework him. At least not because he is hard to play.

**Not all the champion in the game are supposed to be easy to play**
Azir is an hard champion as well as {{champion:64}} {{champion:117}} {{champion:134}} and many others. He is supposed to be hard.
Why you have the need to lower his skillcap? Is that really needed? even if he need a rework he really need it first of {{champion:35}} {{champion:27}} {{champion:106}} {{champion:19}} {{champion:6}} {{champion:82}} {{champion:36}}{{champion:50}} {{champion:24}}  and all the other outdated champs?

I spended an entire year playing Azir. I played him Top Lane, Jungle, Support, Adc even as a Tank ...and now I have to see him reworked just because he is too hard to play? {{champion:64}} players learned insec, ward hop and everything else. The same can happen with Azir.
Hard champions are needed into league. Even if Azir would not be available for those who didn't played him a lot is that a real problem?
with 130+ champions in the game not all of them must be accessible to inexperienced players.

**If you need it nerf him** but pls don't go ahead with a rework. You already upset me with {{champion:69}} rework and {{champion:45}} rework (my 2 old mains). This would be the kill shot.

here there is what they said for those who don't know:
Speaking about Cassio:
> How that work will be prioritized hasn't been determined yet. There are a number of other projects it'd have to be traded off against on either the Live Gameplay (balance) team or the Champion Update (reworks) team (projects like Ryze, Azir, Taric, Yorick etc). 

and
> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NzjhxoyR,comment-id=00a9000000010000,timestamp=2015-10-22T04:00:40.517+0000)
>
> Azir's kit is sufficiently difficult to learn that it doesn't seem to currently be possible to put him in a spot where he's sufficiently balanced for experienced players without being extremely inaccessible to people unfamiliar with him. Learning curve and skill ceiling are great of course, in this case Azir's skill floor's too punishing though. Current intent is to look at ways to make him somewhat more accessible, with if needs be, some nerfs to his top end if those changes buff him there too.


Edit: don't focus on who I wrote to be an hard champs I could have wrote other 20 champs instead of them. 
The point is one: **He is being reworked because he is too hard to play.**

replies.body: How is Lulu hard?

It's not that she's particular hard to play, it's that her W and E have edge cases where you have to make decisions - and people not used to Lulu might not know which decision is best - whereas someone like, say, Ryze, where you can just pick him up and pretty much just mash buttons and come what may.

Ryze is extremely hard to play now, its the reason he has the lowest win rate in the game overall right now. His skill ceiling's not even high enough to make him worthwhile.

I'd say lulu is harder to play well than the average champ, but not by that much. Her skill floor isn't that low, but it takes a good amount of work to get good with her. (I'm not)
He doesn't have the lowest win rate because he is hard to play...he has the lowest win rate because rito nerfed him too much and he sucks.

I beg to differ, people just suck at him and most people who play him probably don't even know his combo (they probably don't even have the correct runes to pull off the combo and get 40% CDR at level 16).
Ryze's skill floor and skill ceiling are on the low side; whereas Lulu's floor and ceiling are both higher than Ryze's, which is my point

Why would they rework him? He seems solid and I agree, he seems to be someone with a higher skill cap than other champions. I've never played him but I feel like he doesn't seem like a champion who is in any need of a rework any time soon. It's only been close to a year since he's been released, and it would unfair to other champions who might require reworks. It's also a bit too early IMO. This seems like an unnecessary move.
Reworking Azir to make him easier to play would be a huge slap in the face for all of us who took the time to learn him.
It's been seven months and designing a champion normally takes nine months. We'll see if he's getting reworked soon enough.

his midgame is already really strong. with 2 items (nashors, rabadons) he deals insane amounts of damage. 
in the lategame he is really safe, he has a lot controll over a teamfight with his soldiers and his wall. he can deal high amounts of damage constantly.

other strenghtes are his insane sieging power.
